org.agilewiki.jactor2.osgi

Interface ServiceChangeReceiver<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of the service expected.
    All Superinterfaces:
    Actor
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    FactoriesImporter, LocateService

    public interface ServiceChangeReceiver<T>
extends Actor
    "Listener" interface that must be implemented by an actor that wants to use a JAServiceTracker to keep track of services.

    NOTE: This interface implies that one actor can only track services of one type (because of the generic type T) of other actor. I'm pretty sure there are many cases where one actor want to keep track of multiple actor types, by using multiple JAServiceTracker. Maybe this is not so optimal ...

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void serviceChange(org.osgi.framework.ServiceEvent _event, java.util.Map<org.osgi.framework.ServiceReference,T> _tracked)
      Called from within the actor's own mailbox, using a request, when registering with a JAServiceTracker, or when some service goes up or down.

      • Methods inherited from interface org.agilewiki.jactor2.core.Actor

        getMailbox

    • Method Detail

      • serviceChange

        void serviceChange(org.osgi.framework.ServiceEvent _event,
                 java.util.Map<org.osgi.framework.ServiceReference,T> _tracked)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Called from within the actor's own mailbox, using a request, when registering with a JAServiceTracker, or when some service goes up or down.
        Parameters:
        _event - The service event, will be null in the initial service change.
        _tracked - The available services.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
